alert.note: Alert for Alger; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 01 at 8:33PM EDT until May 02 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper Michigan and western Upper Michigan, including the following areas, in central Upper Michigan, Alger, Baraga, Dickinson, Iron and Marquette. In western Upper Michigan, Gogebic, Keweenaw, Northern Houghton, Ontonagon and Southern Houghton. * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Where precipitation remains mostly rain, rainfall amounts of a few inches are possible through tonight. Portions of the Keweenaw Peninsula and also other areas along Lake Superior will see the most rain. Very wet, dense snowfall will also be occurring. With air temperatures around freezing, there will be some melting and runoff from the melting snow. As a result, significant rises on area streams, rivers and creeks may occur over the next few days. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
